slideInfo.mainText: 1918: Germany signs an armistice ending World War I; the Kaiser is forced to abdicate his throne; a new democratic government (the Weimar Republic) takes control of Germany 1919: The Versailles Treaty severely punishes and weakens Germany for having started World War I 1923: France invades western Germany when the German government announces it cannot afford to pay war reparations to France; Adolf Hitler leads a failed coup to overthrow the Weimar Republic and spends a year in jail 1924: Germany’s economy begins a strong recovery 1926: Germany signs the Locarno Pact reaffirming the borders established by the Versailles Treaty and pledging to guarantee peace in the future 1928: Germany and 61 other countries sign the Kellogg-Briand Pact proclaiming that “war is illegal”; Hitler’s Nazi party suffers from a significant lack of political support 1929: The Great Depression devastates Germany’s economy and results in massive unemployment and discontent 1932: Election results show the Nazi party is the largest party in Germany (but not a majority) 1933: Hitler becomes chancellor of Germany under President Hindenburg
